Class BattleshipLogic

java.lang.Object
BattleshipLogic
public class BattleshipLogic extends Object
Class serves as the logic for the Battleship Game for 2 player Board games. The methods are designed to help with the implement of a GUI such as getting the lives of the player, board data, if game is over, getting the row or column index from coordinates. The class contains method for unit testing.
Version:
January 28, 2022
Author:
Romandy Vu

  • Constructor Details

    • BattleshipLogic

      public BattleshipLogic()
      The constructor for the Battleship game, serving as a session/game.

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Determines if game is over so GUI stops looping for user's input. This should be a loop condition that prompts for player's input and after player 1 places their hit in that loop.
      Returns:
      true if all of player 1's or player 2's ships are destroyed.

    • placeShip

      public boolean placeShip(int player, String frontCoord, String backCoord, int ship)
      A method for placing the player's ship. Return value helps GUI determine to prompt user to try again. due to an invalid input. There should be: 1 carrier 1 battleship 1 cruiser 1 submarine 1 patrol boat for each board.
      Parameters:
      player - an integer to determine whose turn (1 == player 1, else player 2).
      frontCoord - A coordinate to represent 1 of the ends of the ship to indicate ship placement.
      backCoord - Another coordinate to represent 1 of the ends of the ship to indicate ship placement.
      ship - an int to represent what ship the player is placing. 5 for carrier, 4 for Battleship, 3 for Cruiser/Submarine, 2 for Patrol Boat.
      Returns:
      true if the placement of the ship was successful. False if the input is invalid due to coordinates or overlapping placement of ships.

    • placeHit

      public int placeHit(String coordinate, int player)
      A method to help the GUI determine whether to create a pop of if the player hit something or input is invalid (due to invalid coordinates, or location they already placed) and should try again.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - where the player wants to hit.
      player - which player's turn (1 for player 1, else player 2)
      Returns:
      0 if the player did not hit anything, 1 if the player hits a ship, 2 if the user input is invalid.

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard(int player)
      Resets the a board of a player. Used to help the GUI prompt a message if a player wants to reset their ship placements before placing hits.
      Parameters:
      player - whose board to reset. (1 for player 1, 2 for player 2)

    • getBoard

      public int[][] getBoard(int player)
      Sends back the board of a particular player. Used to help the GUI show the placement of the player's ship when considering other ship placements. This is also used for testing the class.
      Parameters:
      player - the player's ship placement board (1 for player 1, else player 2).
      Returns:
      the player's current board during ship placement.

    • getRowAndColIndex

      public int[] getRowAndColIndex(String coordinate)
      Sends the row and column an array for the GUI to help with updating.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to get the row and column index from.
      Returns:
      an array containing [row, column] respectively.

    • getRowIndex

      public int getRowIndex(String coordinate)
      Returns the row index for the array from the given coordinate. Used to help Battleship GUI.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to get the row index from.
      Returns:
      the row index (integer)

    • getColIndex

      public int getColIndex(String coordinate)
      Returns the column index for the array from the given coordinate. Used to help Battleship GUI.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to get the column index from.
      Returns:
      the column index (integer)

    • getLives

      public int getLives(int player)
      Returns the lives of a player. ( Primarily used for testing)
      Parameters:
      player - the player's lives being looked (1 for player 1, else for player 2)
      Returns:
      the lives of the specified player

    • getCoordinateData

      public int getCoordinateData(String coordinate, int player)
      Returns the value of a coordinate. (Used for testing).
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate being looked at.
      player - the board looked at (1 for player 1, else player 2).
      Returns:
      the value of the coordinate (0,1,2), -1 if invalid.
